texts.ru: Адашева Мухарам проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Её муж работает в строительной компании. Сама она занимается торговлей на рынке. Она покупает и продает лепешки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 16 лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки. Мухарам решила заняться выпечкой хлеба, то есть лепешек, чтобы получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Muharam A. lives in the Bahdat region. She is 43 years old, married and has four children. Her husband works at a construction company. 

On her own, she engages in trade at the market. She buys and sells flatbread. She has been involved in this type of activity for 16 years. The loan is to purchase flour. Muharam decided to engage in baking bread, more specifically flatbread, in order to receive bigger profits.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jemama

texts.en:
Jemama is 28 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She has two children who are three and seven years old. Her children live with her and also attend school. Jemama was only able to complete eighth grade. 

For the past seven years, Jemama has been selling both clothes and charcoal. She makes more of a profit during the rainy season than in the dry season. Jemama is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes, charcoal, and rice for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, charcoal, and rice to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and lives in the New Kru area.   He and his partner have three children, aged  2, 5 and 13.  They are all in school.

For five years, James has been running a medicine store providing service to his community.  He’s requesting a loan to purchase more drugs (Paracetamol, Folic Acid, etc.).   He plans to open his own clinic in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs (Paracetamol, Folic Acid etc.)

loans.name: Narzi

texts.ru: Шоева Нарзи проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 50 лет. Вдова, имеет 6 детей. Её сын находится в России на заработках. Сама она предоставляет услугу. У нее имеется столовая, где она работает поваром. В этой области она более 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимой посуды.
texts.en: Narzi S. lives in the Yavan region. She is 50 years old, a widow and has six children. Her son is away working in Russia. For her work, she offers services. She has a dining room where she works as a chef. She was been working in this area for more than ten years. The loan will pay for needed utensils.

loans.use: to purchase needed utensils

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace currently sells bread.   She is 35 years old and married, with 5 children, 3 of whom go to school. Grace requested a loan to stock more bread to sell. 

She hopes to buy a piece of land and construct a concrete house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Otthefia

texts.en:
Othefia is 44 years old and lives in Logan town.  He’s married, with six children between the ages of  6 months and 11 years.  All but the baby are attending school.

Othefia has been running a provision shop for the past 15 years, but due to insufficient inventory his sales are always low.  He’s requesting a loan to purchase more provisions (soft drinks, water, rice etc.)  He plans to improve his business and send his children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions (soft drinks, water, rice etc.)

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna A. is 33 years old and married. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has two sons.  The older one is eleven, and the younger one is two years old. 
Anna runs her own business, which consists of selling clothes at the trade fair.  Anna buys dresses, blouses, skirts, etc,. from Turkey and sells them at the “Russia” fair in Yerevan. Anna spends part of her profit to provide for her family.

This is Anna’s 11th loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva. She has never delayed her repayments, and now she is asking for a $1,500 to buy a clothes assortment for her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothes for her business

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly currently sells cooking oil and soap.  She is 28 years old and married, with 3 children, all of whom go to school.

 Lilly requested a loan to stock more cooking oil and soap to sell. She hopes to pay for her children's schooling and buy a car in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more cooking oil and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural spices and seeds

loans.name: Leh We Pray Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you members of the “Leh We Pray” group. They are small scale businesswomen, based in Makeni city. They are requesting for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each, to enable them to further improve upon the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured, on the right, is Zainab K.. She is the leader of this group. Zainab was born in Makeni. She is married to a carpenter and the couple has 3 children – 2 in secondary school and the other is not yet of school going age.

Zainab sells rice, oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing this business for 18 years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities, to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, margi, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki B. lives in the village of Mukhrani, Imereti Region. He is 55 years old, married and lives with his wife Fatima, 9-year-old son and 81-year-old father. 

Akaki and Fatima are involved in family agricultural activities. They have three greenhouses with a total area of 900 sq meters. In the period from November to April, greens are grown in the greenhouses.They are sold locally to the wholesalers. In the period from June to September, the greenhouse is used for growing tomatoes. The harvested tomatoes are sold in Kutaisi Market. Also, the family owns 1000 sq meters of agricultural land. They grow greens on this land to sell at the Kutaisi Market. In addition, the family owns two milk cows, one bull and one calf. Part of the milk products are used by the family and the other part is sold locally. 

Akaki requested a loan for tilling the land. He will purchase diesel for the tractor and pay the owner of the tractor for the service. This year, Akaki plans to sow maize and watermelon on his plot of land. Akaki and Fatima hope that they will have a good harvest. The maize will be used for feeding the domestic animals and the watermelon will be sold at Kutaisi Market. 

Akaki and Fatima plan to reinvest part of their profits in the further development of their agricultural farm. As for the rest – it will be used to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase diesel and pay the owner of the tractor.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice currently sells cooking oil. She is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. All of her children go to school. Joice borrowed a loan to stock more cooking oil to sell. She hopes to open a big shop in the future, with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 58 years old and married. She has five children. 

Rosemary does poultry farming to earn a living. She runs her business with one employee. She hopes to open other branches of her business in the future.  She joined Mafuno group in Faulu Kenya so that she would get financial support. So far, she has serviced three loans from Faulu Kenya. Her business has really improved, as has her standard of living. She would like to take a loan for 50,000 KES to buy chicks.

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and four siblings (some of them are still attending school). Despite his young age, he has built up good experience working in the construction field for five years as a wall foliage laborer. In 2009, he started taking projects and working on a freelance basis. With his business income, this young man helps his father pay for the family expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase wood for his newest projects. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening his own construction office.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in the business of selling cooking oil. She is a 46 years old widow. All of her 8 children go to school. Mary borrowed a loan to stock more cooking oil to sell. She hopes to expand her business, in the future, with the extra profits from this business.

loans.use: to stock more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Kagabi Multi Purpose Group

texts.en: N. Aisha is 29 years old. She has operated her restaurant for 5 years now, in Mpigi Town. Aisha is happily married and has 3 kids. She says that she was inspired by her friends to set forth in this business. Previously, Aisha, who comes across as a stickler of hard work, says she more into farming. She says her weekly profits are in the amount of Uganda shillings 70,000. She says with this loan, she is going to purchase more foods to be prepared and resold at the restaurant.

loans.use: The purchase of more food to be prepared and resold at the restaurant.

loans.name: Datuna

texts.en:
Datuna B. lives in the village of Bandza, Martvili District, in the western part of Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Maka, 4-year-old daughter, and 61-year-old mother. Datuna and Maka run the agricultural activities of the family, which are the main source of the income for the family. They have a 220 sq meter greenhouse and a plot of land. They grow cucumbers and tomatoes, which are sold locally as well as in nearby villages. The family has been involved in this business for 10 years. During this period, they have been working hard to expand their farm. 

With the requested loan, Datuna and Maka plan to purchase fertilizers to cultivate the land. After fertilizing the plot and the greenhouse, they will get more and better quality harvest, resulting in increased income for the family. Part of the profit will be used to cover family daily expenses and the rest will be reinvested in the business – in particular, the family plans to build a second greenhouse for growing vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, 5 of whom are in school.  Sauda  has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Sauda has requested for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and cooking oil. She also generates additional income by selling bananas. 

The main business challenges for Sauda include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and to own her own house.  Sauda lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene B. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 10 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother and father).  Irene has a restaurant business.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Irene has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes.  She also generates additional income through part-time teaching.

The main business challenges for Irene include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant.  Irene lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication

loans.use: to buy more bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with one parent and five siblings. He started his career at a very young age working in an air-conditioning company.  In parallel, and during his free time, this man works on a freelance basis setting up air conditioners and repairing the ruined ones. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new engine for his car so that he can travel around diverse areas and villages in order to serve all customers wherever they are located.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory

loans.name: Fabio De Jesus

texts.es:
Fabio es un emprendedor que desde hace varios años trabaja vendiendo artículos propios de la construcción, también fabrica productos en cemento, arena, hierro y alambre; en esta actividad trabajan sus 4 hijos y su esposa, y es de esta manera que se generan los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento del hogar, sin embargo el lugar donde tienen su negocio no es el adecuado, por lo que necesitan hacerle los ajustes necesarios para no sólo desarrollar la actividad si no para que ese espacio sea agradable también para sus clientes.

 

Debido a que Fabio tuvo pocas oportunidades de estudiar por sus escasos recursos, desde joven se caracterizó por su tenacidad, por ello, durante muchos años y con la ilusión de salir adelante se desempeñó como obrero en construcciones de la ciudad de Medellín, pero un día motivado por la ilusión de tener lo propio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia decidió darle vida a su propio negocio en el que trabaja 12 horas diarias que como él mismo lo afirma, se justifica, porque es la oportunidad para hacer crecer sus ventas y la comercialización de sus propios productos, y así poco a poco mejorar su futuro y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Fabio is an entrepreneur who for the last several years has been selling construction materials.  He also makes cement products and products from sand, metal and wire.  His 4 children and wife help in this activity, and this way they earn the income that they need to support the family.  The space where they have their business is not adequate and therefore they need to make the necessary adjustments to not only improve the business but also to make the space more attractive to their customers.

Due to his limited resources, Fabio had very few opportunities to go to school.  He stood out for his tenacity since he was young and worked as a laborer in construction projects in the city of Medellin for many years in order to get ahead.  One day, motivated by the desire to be on his own and improve the quality of life for his family, he decided to launch his own business.  He works at this 12 hours a day.  As he himself affirms, it is justified as this is the opportunity to increase his sales and market his own products.  Little by little he can improve his future and that of his family.

loans.use: to adapt the space for his business.

loans.name: Donah

texts.en:
Donah T. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (2 sisters).    Donah has a business selling second shoes.  She has been in this business for less than a year, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Donah sells her products in a shop.    

Donah  has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second hand shoes.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenges for Donah include thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell at wholesale only and to start importing shoes herself.  Donah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand shoes

loans.name: Terre Promise Plus Group

texts.en:
Veronique, aged 42, is the manager of this Community Bank groupm named “Terre Promise Plus” which means “Promised Land”. The group is composed of 9 members, united in solidarity, for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Veronique operates a clothing store in one of the largest markets in the capital city of Kinshasa. She became a micro entrepreneur in 2003 with a beginning capital of US$50. Her business is located in the northern area of Kinshasa. She has already received five loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. 

Veronique intends to use this loan to buy dozens of cookware to resell at a profit, in order to increase her income. Currently she earns a profit of $200 per month. Her dream is to someday open several clothing stores in Kinshasa and to purchase items directly from China. Veronique is married and mother to six children, between the ages of 6 and 23. All of the children attend school.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of cookware to resell at profit in order to increase her income.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Norbey De Jesus

texts.es:
Norbey de Jesús es un joven que vive en el municipio de Sonsón Antioquia,  desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a transportar todo tipo de materiales en un vehículo que él mismo adecuó con una plataforma que carga el material y que a su vez es arrastrado por su caballo, su carreta como es tradicionalmente conocida es su única fuente de ingresos, pues la falta de oportunidades laborales en el que vive lo obligó a ser independiente y conocer la ley del rebusque. En su carreta Norbey transporta materiales, acarreos y diferentes tipos de carga para lo que lo contratan. 

 

Durante todos estos años Norbey ha trabajado con el mismo caballo, por lo que siente la necesidad de comprar otro equino más joven que le ayude a agilizar sus recorridos, no solo por mejorar el servicio si no también por la salud de su antiguo caballo. Pero los ingresos que se generan no son suficientes para la inversión, por lo cual Norbey necesita de un préstamo que le permita la compra el caballo. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia por lo que trabajará día a día hasta lograr su mas grande anhelo.
texts.en:
Norbey de Jesús is a young man who lives in the municipality of Sonsón Antioquia. From a very young age he has been engaged in transporting all types of materials in a horse-drawn vehicle adapted for carrying cargo. His cart is traditionally designed and is his only source of income, for he lacks other employment opportunities where he lives, and it allows him to be independent and to get by. On his cart, Norbey transports freight and different types of cargo.

For years, Norbay has worked with the same horse. That’s why he now feels the need to buy another, younger horse to help him speed up his journeys. This will not only improve the service he gives. It will also benefit the health of his old horse.

Since Norbay’s income is not sufficient to make this investment he needs a loan that will permit the purchase of a horse. His biggest dream is to have his own house.. That’s why he will work every day until he achieves his greatest desire.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for speeding up his transport service.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of attend school. Eva has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 3 months, and she works 6 days out of every week. Eva sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Eva has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Eva include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to start importing clothes herself. Eva  lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, all of whom attend school. Berna has a business of a pub. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Berna sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.    

Berna has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin. She also generates additional income through her retail shop.

The main business challenge(s) for Berna include thieves and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar. Berna lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, bu no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah M. lives in the Mengo Mackay neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Deborah has a business of a Beauty salon. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Deborah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Deborah has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream hair relaxers and braids. 

The main business challenge(s) for Deborah include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also to educate her children up to university level. Deborah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream hair relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Iccel Amanda

texts.es: Iccel es casada su esposo trabaja como conductor, con su apoyo ha puesto su propio negocio una pulpería siendo de una gran importancia económica para los beneficio de su familia. Sus planes que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente, en el negocio captar mayores clientela. En su pulpería vende productos de uso diario. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería en mayores cantidades y variedad como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, jabones, detergente,  lampazos, variedades de bisutería, cereales, refrescos, lácteos entre otros productos que le generara mayores ganancias ofreciéndole a su familia mejores beneficios.
texts.en: Iccel is married and her husband works as a driver.  With his support she set up a general store because it is very important for the financial needs of her family.  Her plans are that her children study to be professionals.  In her business she wants to  have more customers and she sells a variety of everyday items in her store.  She will use the loan to buy larger quantities and a greater variety of merchandise such as: rice, beans, oil, soaps, detergent, mops, different types of costume jewelry, cereals, soft drinks, dairy products and other items that will give her higher earnings so that she can offer more to her family

loans.use: To buy products to stock her general store

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet B. lives in the Lubaga Road neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her late sister’s children).

Annet has a business of a pub. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Annet sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Annet has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local Gin. She also generates additional income through a restaurant. 

The main business challenge(s) for Annet include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling by wholesale only and also to build her own house. Annet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local Gin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials and service the motorcycle that he uses to transport his goods.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Lubaga Road neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of whom are in school.  

Harriet has a business of selling old shoes. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 6 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of shoes. She also generates additional income through roasting maize and green bananas.

The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling by wholesale only and also to build her own house. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Amparo Justina

texts.es: Amparo casada mujer trabajadora, honesta, humilde. Su esposo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Sus hijos estudiantes. Tiene su propio negocio venta de tortilla y nacatamales desde hace un tiempo lo tiene siendo e ingreso al hogar. Lo inicio con fondo propios requiere aumentar sus ventas ya que tiene proyecto de mejorar su vivienda. El préstamo que solicitad será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como. Cemento, hierro, bloques, piedras cantera, arena, piedrín, estribu, reglones de madera, para levantar una pared de la casa. Obteniendo seguridad para su familia y negocio.
texts.en:
Amparo is a hardworking, honest, and humble woman. She is married; her husband works and helps her economically. Her children are students. She has her own business where she sells tortillas and nacatamales (a Nicaraguan dish), which has been a source of income for her household for some time. Amparo started this business with her own funds and would like to increase her sales because she has a plan to make some improvements in her home. 

The loan will be used to purchase construction materials for building a wall -- sand, concrete blocks, gravel, cement, wooden beams and others. These home improvements will allow Amparo to provide greater comfort and safety for her family and for her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building a wall

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario casado, su esposa ama de casa realiza venta de refrescos, helados y otras cositas de golosinas  tiene un hija en secundaria, el trabaja como guardia de seguridad desde hace tiempo. La seguridad es necesaria por el lugar donde vive. Con el crédito anteriormente construyo un muro, en este nuevo ciclo continuara invirtiendo en las mejorar de la infraestructura de su casa comprando materiales como: cemento, láminas de zinc, golosas, hierro, arena, piedras canteras entre otros que será utilizada  para construir un cuarto que se requiere. Obteniendo mayor comodidad y seguridad para la familia.
texts.en:
Mario is married and his wife, who remains at home, sells soft drinks, ice cream and other little snacks. They have a daughter who is in secondary school. He has worked for some time as a security guard. Security is important in the area where they live. 

With his last loan, Mario constructed a wall around his house. In this new loan cycle, he hopes to continue investing in improving the infrastructure of his house, buying materials such as cement, zinc sheeting, rafters, iron, sand, and building stone, among other things to construct a necessary room.

This will provide more comfort and security for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a room onto his house and gain security.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José se dedica al transporte publico trabaja en el radio móvil hace 2 años tiene un auto que ahora se encuentra en el mecánico  parado por que su motor se fundió por el uso que le da el señor,  el crédito que se le otorgó es para el cambio de motor para su vehículo y algunas refacciones mas el señor José se hizo cargo de sus dos hijos cuando su esposa lo abandonó  el señor se fue a vivir con su papa quien tiene una casa en la zona de angostura A 15 kilómetros distante de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  También le ayuda a su papa en la atención de su restaurant y con la amplificación de su local, es una persona muy trabajadora siempre velando por sus dos hijos ya que su deseo del Sr. José es el ver algún día profesional a su hijos y personas de bien, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José provides public transportation services.  He’s had a radio dispatched taxi for two years.  It’s currently immobilized at the mechanics because the engine froze due to the use he puts it to. 

The loan granted is to replace the vehicle’s engine and for a few other parts that are needed.  José took charge of his two children when his wife left him.  He went to live with his father who has a house in Angostura, 15 kilometers away from the city of Cochabamba.  He also helps his father tend to his restaurant and to enlarge his locale.

He is a very hard working person who is always watching over his two children because José’s wish is to someday see his children become professionals and upstanding citizens.  

He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to replace his vehicle's engine.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph B. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Joseph has a hardware business, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hardware items for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Joseph hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware items for resale.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel K. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Israel has a rental houses business, which he has run for four years.
To help expand his business, Israel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials for building more rental houses. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Israel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for building more rental houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils, a pressure cooker and a blender.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex M. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Alex has a hardware shop business, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hardware items for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Alex hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to become a big wholesaler of hardware in his town.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware items for resale.

loans.name: Por Venir Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "POR VENIR" se encuentra en su séptimo ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco D. Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias: Presidenta es la señora Beneranda quien convive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos pequeños que se encuentran en edad escolar, su actividad económica es la D. pintor juntamente con su pareja y como actividad secundaria es la D. empleada D. limpieza, ya que cuando no tienen contratos para pintar casas la Sra. realiza limpieza en casas e instituciones, con el dinero del credito comprara pintura por cantidad y materiales y herramientas para el pintado D. casas es una persona muy trabajadora ya que junto a su esposo mantienen a su familia unida, su deseo es el D. poder comprar su casita para así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurial bank "POR VENIR" is in its seventh cycle; its members are hardworking and responsible people. Beneranda is the president of the bank; she lives with her partner and has four school age children. Beneranda and her husband's main economic activity is painting houses. In addition, when they do not have a house-painting project, she also gets temporary work cleaning homes and offices.

Beneranda will use the loan to purchase paint in quantity as well as other materials and tools necessary for house-painting work. She is a very hardworking person; together with her husband they keep a very close family. Her wish is to buy a house so that she could bring a greater level of comfort to her family. She is very grateful for all the help that is provided.

loans.use: to purchase paint in quantity; to purchase materials and tools for painting houses

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). 

Harriet has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail. Harriet has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow and she would like to start importing clothes herself. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret K. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Margret has a poultry business, which she has run for six years.
To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Margret hopes to be the main supplier of chickens in her area.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence W. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Florence has a poultry business, which she has run for over ten years.
To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly S. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Jolly has a piggery firm, which she has run for eight years.
To help expand her business, Jolly has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more pigs for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jolly hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick B. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Patrick has a poultry firm, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken feed for the chickens he raises for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Patrick hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feed.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene N. lives in the Lugala neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). 

Irene has a business of a medical shop. She has been in this business for 9 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Irene sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 1500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of drugs and syringes. She also generates additional income through working as a nurse.

The main business challenge(s) for Irene include rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow and she would like to own a health center with 3 clinics. Irene lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of drugs and syringes.

loans.name: Johnny Braulio

texts.es: El sr. Johnny  vive en la zona de barrio municipal tiene su esposa y tres hijos en edad escolar, el trabaja con su movilidad en la línea de taxi trufis que va en la ruta de  centro  a la zona sur y su esposa trabaja en una guardería de niños ambos bastante trabajadores son clientes antiguos de nuestra institución, necesita este crédito para la reparación del vehículo ya que es su medio subsistencia de la familia  y compra de llantas para el mismo razón por la que se solicita el financiamiento, el deseo del Sr. Johnny es el poder comprar un terreno para hacer construir su casita y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, el es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Johnny lives in the Barrio Municipal zone.  He has a wife and three school age children.  He works with his vehicle in a cooperative taxi route that goes from downtown to the southern zone.  His wife works at a children’s daycare center.  Both are quite hard working and longstanding clients of our institution.

He needs this loan to repair his vehicle since it’s his means to support his family and to buy tires for it; this is the reason behind the loan request.

Johnny’s wish is to be able to buy a piece of property to build his house and provide his family with more comfort.  He is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and to buy tires.

loans.name: Matin

texts.en:
Matin S. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is single and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Matin has a poultry business, which he has run for two years.
To help expand his business, Matin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken feed to feed the chickens he raises for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Matin hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken feed.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy K. lives in the Kawaala neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). 

Cissy has a business of selling religious articles. She has been in this business for 9 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Cissy sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. She has requested for a loan of 1500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of rosaries, bibles, calendars, candles and portraits’ of holy people and other religious publications.The main business challenge(s) for Cissy include the rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to own permanent business premises.   

Cissy lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of bibles, rosaries, calendars and portraits of saints.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, es taxista, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 11 y 14 años de edad, él trabaja desde hace 16 años, fue iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 7:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para el taxi, ya que este ha presentado problemas mecánicos, este préstamo le ayudara a mantenerlo en buenas condiciones, así prestar un buen servicio evitando un accidente.
Su aspiración es apoyar a sus hijos, por medio del trabajo, brindarles seguridad y la culminación de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the city of San Miguel. He’s a Taxi Driver.  He lives with his wife and two children who are 11 and 4 years of age.   He’s been working for the last 16 years.  He started on his own initiative.  He works every day from 6am until 7pm.

He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the taxi because it’s having some mechanical problems.  This loan will help him maintain it in good condition to provide good service and avoid accidents.

His goal is to support his children through his work, to provide them with security and the completion of their schooling.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for the taxi.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha  vive en bella vista y tiene su negocio en el mercado de la zona, tiene tres hijos ya independientes, desde hace tiempo ella es padre y madre de sus hijos por que el esposo les abandonó, sola saco adelante a su hijos de lo que se siente orgullosa, la Sra. Bertha es bastante trabajadora y responsable  también podemos destacar de que la Sra. Tiene bastante clientela en el mercado ya que tiene pensionados  y otros clientes  al día cocina al rededor de 80 a 100 almuerzos los cuales siempre termina  le va bien porque la Sra. es bastante amable  con todos y tiene buen sazón en el preparado de sus almuerzos, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos  por mayor como ser arroz, papa, fideo, la Sra. esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Bertha lives in Bella Vista and has her business in the local market.  She has three independent children.  For some time now she’s been both father and mother to her children because her husband abandoned them.  She raised her children by herself which makes her very proud.

Bertha is quite hard working and responsible.  We can also highlight that she has quite a large clientele in the market because she has a lot of retirees and other customers.  She cooks around 80-100 meals which always sell out.  She does well because she’s quite gracious to everyone and her meals are prepared quite tastily.

On this occasion she’s asking for a loan to buy rice, potatoes and noodles at wholesale.  She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install water pipes and electric wiring in his house.

loans.name: Mohammad Khair

texts.en:
Mohammad Khair is a 29-year-old single man. He owns an Internet station, which provides Internet to homes and offices in his area and nearby villages. At the beginning, he had no competitors as he was the first to provide such a service in his region.

Mohammad is well-known in his area. He has excellent customer service, as most of his clients state. He started this business in 2000. His 11 years of experience gave him a special place in this sector. 

Mohammad Khair is requesting a loan, for the first time, in order to buy updated machines necessary for his business. These machines help in providing the customers with the best connection in the region.

Mohammad hopes to open a car-rental company, which is a dream he is working hard to achieve soon.

loans.use: to buy new updated machines necessary for his business.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 42 años, vive en su casa propia con su  esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace 17 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, en donde los compra y al cabo de un tiempo de alimentación y cuidado los vende a un mejor precio. Su establo se encuentra dentro de su territorio donde vive, en ella dispone de áreas extensas, y es ahí donde se alojan los toros jóvenes y las vacas. Por otro lado comercializa la leche que ordeña a los fabricantes de productos lácteos. Considera que su actividad que a lo largo de estos años le ha generado las ganancias, es por ello que desea tener un establo de vacas y toros de buena raza. Es su crédito número 12 que tiene con MFP, considera que pertenecer a un banco comunal  ha sido una experiencia positiva y gratificantes de la cuales aprendió bastante sobre el ahorro y de las cuales esta agradecida por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de remedios para sus reses, así como comprará una ternera.
texts.en: Delfina, 42, lives in her own house with her husband and their 3 children. For 17 years she has raised animals, buying them and selling them for a higher price after feeding and caring for them for a while. Her stable is within the territory where she lives, and that is where the young bulls and the cows stay. She has extensive areas at her disposal. In addition she also sells the milk from her cows to dairy producers. Through these years she feels her business has provided good earnings. Now she wants to have a stable of purebred cattle. This is her 12th loan with MFP. She feels that belonging to a communal bank has been a positive and worthwhile experience. She has learned a lot about saving, and she is grateful for the loans and promises to be punctual with her payments. With this loan she will purchase remedies for her cattle as well as purchase a calf.

loans.use: to purchase remedies for her cattle and to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Sulaina

texts.en:
Sulaina N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). Sulaina has a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days out of every week. She also generates additional income through selling Bitengi (African attire). She sells her products in the shop, by means of retail.    

Sulaina has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and weaves.  

The main business challenges for Sulaina include the rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to own a bridal salon. She lives in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise to expand her business

loans.name: Jose Segundo

texts.es:
José es soltero de 33 años de edad, tiene casa propia, contando con los servicios de agua luz solamente, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Quemazon a 15 minutos del distrito de Mórrope a 30 minutos deldepartamentode Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla José es ha la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, etc.), en su domicilio desde hace unos años, al encontrarse su negocio en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para su uso personal.

El crédito solicitado por José a Edpyme Alternativa es de 3000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para la comprar mayor diversidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten.

El sueño de José es tener un negocio mayorista que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y lo logrará con su trabajo y empeño.
texts.en:
José is a single, 33 year old man. He has his own home, which only has electricity and running water. It is located in the community of Quemazon,15 minutes from the district of Mórrope, 30 minutes from the department of Lambayeque. This area is dedicated to farming, cattle and tourism. 

The activity José does has been selling basic necessity products (rice, milk, oil, sugar, etc.), from his home for some years. Since the business is in his home, he can attend to it at any time, allowing himself to distinguish himself from the other stores and thus obtain more income for his personal use.  

The loan José has asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for 3000 nuevos soles. This will be used to diversify his merchandise and thus expand his business with more products once his sales increase.  

José's dream is to have a wholesale business that generates good income to improve his quality of life. He will accomplish this with his hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to buy more materials to outfit and expand his business.

loans.name: Manuel Urbano

texts.es:
Urbano es un señor casado de  66 años de edad que vive en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. La comunidad donde vive Urbano tiene como característica principal los deseos de superación de su gente, lo que los lleva a ser personas emprendedoras y dispuestas a aprovechar las oportunidades que se les presenten. Ésta es una comunidad principalmente agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Urbano, desde hace 15 años,  es la agricultura.  Éste cuenta con 4 hectáreas de terreno agrícola, tres de ellas son de mango y una de limón. Las especies de frutos de don Urbano son de muy buena calidad, esto se debe, en gran parte, por el buen cuidado que Urbano les da. Él asiste diariamente a su chacra para vigilar el desarrollo de sus productos.

Urbano solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de fertilizante para el cultivo de mango y deshierbo del mismo, para lograr una mejor producción y por ende vender a un mejor precio sus productos.

Urbano desea seguir creciendo en su actividad para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Urbano is a 66-year old married man who lives in the district of Tambogrande, Piura. The community where Urbano lives may be characterized by the wish of its population for self-improvement, driving them to be enterprising people who are ready to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves. This community is primarily an agricultural and farming community.

Urbano has been an agriculturist for the past 15 years. He has 4 hectares of agricultural land, three have mangoes and one has lemons. Urbano's fruit products are of very good quality and largely this is due to the good care that he provides. He works in his plantations every day to monitor the development of his products.

Urbano requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of fertilizers for his mango plantation and to weed it to have a better production and to sell at a better price.

Urbano wishes to keep developing his business to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to weed his land.

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es:
Carlos, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, vive con su esposa y un hijo de dos años de edad.  Él es agricultor desde hace 8 años, aprendió de sus padres  trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, ya que se dispone a iniciar la siembra de maíz, esta compra es muy importante para Carlos ya que con estos insumos dará un mejor cuido.
Su objetivo es cuidar de su hijo, cuando crezca ayudarlo en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel. He cultivates corn and beans. He lives with his wife and their two-year old son. He has been an agriculturist for 8 years, having learned the trade from his parents. He works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

He requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and treatments for plagues to get ready to start his corn plantation. This purchase is very important for Carlo because with these products he will be able to provide better care to his fields.

His objective is to support his son and, when he grows up, to send him to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador muy hacendoso en sus labores, tiene 44 años D. edad y 3 hijos a su cargo que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Diego vive en L. zona rural del caserío C. del Medano, ubicado a 25 minutos D. L. ciudad D. Morrope –  Chiclayo.

Diego se gana L. vida desD. hace 6  años vendiendo animales menores, que él mismo cría en corrales ubicados en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio. Diego cuenta con un  ganado porcino y  ovino. Además gana algo D. dinero extra por brindar sus servicios en labores agrícolas.

Diego solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles, para ampliar su negocio, puesto que los gastos en L. educación D. sus hijos lo requieren. Específicamente Diego quiere invertir en L. compra D. aves menores para engorD. y en alimento balanceado para sus cerdos.  A pesar D. L. competencia que tiene este trabajo, Diego se siente confiado D. poder obtener ganancias porque existe un amplio sector donD. se pueD. comercializar.

Diego tiene experiencia con Edpyme Alternativa, es un cliente antigua que goza D. un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Diego is an enterprising and hardworking man who is very industrious with his work. He is 44 years old and he has 3 school-aged children in his care. Diego lives in the rural community of C. del Medano, located at 25 minutes from the city of Morrope, Chiclayo.

For the past 6 years, Diego has earned a living by selling small livestock that he raises himself in corrals located in the rear section of his property. Diego has pigs and sheep. He also earns extra money by providing his services in agricultural projects. 

Diego requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to expand his business especially because his children's educational expenses require it. Specifically, Diego wants to invest in the purchase of poultry to raise and to purchase balanced feed for his pigs. Despite the competition in his field of work, Diego feels confident in obtaining a profit because there is a large market to which he can sell. 

Diego has had experience with Edpyme Alternativa, being a long time client, and he enjoys a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and livestock feed.

loans.name: Maria Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni es una señora D. 37 años D. edad que vive hace 10 años con su esposo e hija, en casa D. su madre. Todos ellos son una familia muy unida. Viven en el distrito D. Patapo en Chiclayo. Esta comunidad es una comunidad D. comerciantes y también existe una gran cantidad D. personas que laboran para empresas azucareras que se encuentran ubicadas en la  zona.

Marleni tiene una pequeña bodega D. comestibles y además comercializa todo tipo D. ropa y calzado para adultos y niños, esta actividad la viene realizando hace 6 años desD. su domicilio. 

Marleni tiene buenas perspectivas para su negocio, ella piensa ampliarlo y llegar a comercializar otros productos, como accesorios D. vestir y artículos para el hogar.

Gracias a su negocio, Marleni cuenta con una buena calidad D. vida y  su hija goza D. estos beneficios también. Marleni solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles para volver a invertir en el negocio que tanto le produce, específicamente ella quiere comprar prendas D. vestir y calzado D. la nueva temporada, pues sus clientes lo solicitan.

Marleni ha cancelado con puntualidad los créditos que Edpyme Alternativa le ha brindado con anterioridad.
texts.en:
Marleni is a 37-year old woman who has lived with her husband and daughter together in her mother's house. They form a very close family. They live in the district of Patapo in Chiclayo. It is a community of merchants and a large number of individuals works in the sugar factories of the region.

Marleni has a small grocery store and she also sells all types of clothing and shoes for adults and children. She has managed her business from her house for the past 6 years.

Marleni has good ideas for her business. She plans on expanding it and to start selling other products, such as accessories and articles for the home.

Thanks to her business, Marleni enjoys a good quality of life and her daughter also enjoys these benefits. Marleni requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) of 2000 nuevos soles to invest in her successful business. Specifically, she wants to purchase articles of clothing and shoes for the new season as requested by her clients.

Marleni has repaid past loans on time with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad tiene 59 años de edad, es soltero, cuenta con casa propia con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del caserío de Chosica del Norte a 10 minutos del distrito de la Victoria, la cual pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona la actividad principal es el comercio, agricultura y turismo (tiene festividades religiosas muy bonitas).

Natividad desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado porcino (cerdos) y vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos.

Ha solicitado Natividad un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar animales de raza para mejorar la calidad de su leche con el ganado vacuno y de su tamaño y carne en el ganado porcino, con la finalidad de obtener un mejor precio con sus clientes y así mejoraría  su calidad de vida.

Natividad es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio cresca cada vez más.
texts.en:
Natividad is 59 years old, single, and he owns his own home. It is equipped with running water and hydro. It is located in the community of Chosica del Norte, at 10 minutes from the district of La Victoria, belonging to the province of Chiclayo. This region's primary business activities are commerce, agriculture, and tourism (enjoying very beautiful religious festivities). 

Natividad has been raising and selling pigs and cows for the past 10 years. His corral is located outside his house. He feeds them balanced feed and natural grasses so that his they will have an optimum development and so that he will be able to sell them in the markets of the region. He will obtain good profits to cover his expenses. 

Natividad has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase better livestock to produce a better quality of milk, and to improve the size and quality of meat from his pigs. His objective is to obtain a better price from his clients and to improve his quality of life. 

Natividad is a hardworking and very responsible person. The only thing that he wants is to keep his business growing.

loans.use: to purchase quality livestock.

location.town: Chosica del Norte - La Victoria - Chiclayo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install flooring in her house.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 11 años que tiene su tienda, instalada en su misma casa, negocio del cual se encarga casi las 24 horas del día, asimismo sus hijos la ayudan cuando tienen tiempo libre. Siempre esta pendiente de la cantidad de mercadería que este repleta para dar a su clientela la mayor variedad de productos. Sus ventas son continuas durante las mañanas, es por eso que para ella es vital tener la mercadería en el momento oportuno y aprovecha cada temporada del año cuando festividades vender más. Las rentas que recibe le permiten seguir adelante por lo que ha decidido ampliar más su tienda y comprar más mercadería y complementarla con frutas y útiles de escritorio. Es su crédito número 13 con MFP, es relativamente nueva en su banco comunal como integrantes y considera que ha sido una buena experiencia formar parte de  su grupo que le ha enseñado buenos aspectos en cuanto al cuidado de su finanzas es por esto que se compromete una vez más a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in a house that is their own. She started her store business 11 years ago and it is installed in her own home. She operates her business almost 24 hours a day. Her children help her during their spare time. She always makes sure to have plenty of inventory in order to offer her clients with the widest selection of products. Her sales are steady in the mornings and for this reason it is vital for her to have the merchandise on hand. She takes advantage during the time of year when the sales for the holidays are more. The profits she earns enables her to move forward so she has decided to expand her store and to purchase more merchandise, including fruits and office supplies. This is her 13th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She is relatively new member of her communal bank and she feels that it has been a good experience to become part of a group. It has showed her different perspectives on managing finances. For this reason she is committed once again to be punctual with her payments. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to supply her store.

loans.use: to purchase products to supply her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, boxes, and sacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: New Hope Group

texts.es: La Sra. Elvira   es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar  y tiene 33 años D. edad, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Nueva esperanza” grupo  conformado por 11  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Elvira  trabaja desD. hace  4  años en la venta D. comida  en un puesto en el mercado, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que el sueldo D. su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos básicos D. su hogar , servicio, educación , alimentación, es asi que Elvira pone su negocio con el deseo D. salir adelante y darle lo mejor a sus hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo  y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, ha construido su casa, y sus hijos reciben educación privada y sobre todo tienen una mejor calidad D. vida . El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Elvira  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Elvira is married common-law and she has 2 school-aged children. She is 33 years old and she is a member of the communal bank named "New Hope". The group is maD. up of 11 members who are involved in a variety of business activities. Elvira has been selling prepared foods at a stand in the market for the past 4 years. This business came about because her husband's income was not enough to cover the basic household expenses, including utilities, education, and food. Elvira started her business from a wish to move forward and to proviD. the best for her children. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has earned a better income. She has built her house and her children are in private school, but above all they enjoy a better quality of life. The loan that was granted to her was to purchase merchandise. We know that Elvira will achieve her goals through hard work and effort and the loans from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her do that.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Maria Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema es  un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa, ella  es una madre de familia cariñosa y atenta con sus 3 hijos y esposo. Tiene 43 años de edad y vive en un caserío (comunidad rural de condición muy pobre) ubicado en el distrito de Pitipo en la provincia de Chiclayo – Lambayeque.

Zulema tiene mucha experiencia en cuanto al manejo de las tierras, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con 2 hectáreas de maíz amarillo duro que necesitan mantenimiento. Es por ello que Zulema solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles, que le permitirán fertilizar y deshierbar sus tierras.  Zulema tendría un mayor rendimiento por hectárea lo cual la llevaría  a tener mayores ingresos para su familia.

Zulema ha tenido dos créditos cancelados con puntualidad y responsabilidad. Estos la ayudaron a capitalizarse al sembrar más hectáreas de terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Zulema is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). She is the loving mother of a family and she is attentive to her 3 children and her husband. She is 43 years old and she lives in a community (a poor rural community) located in the district of Pitipo in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque.

Zulema has a great deal of experience in working the land. She has been dedicated to agriculture for the past 10 years. She has 2 hectares of hard yellow corn and it needs upkeep. For this reason Zulema requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) of 3000 nuevos soles. This will help her fertilize and weed her fields. Zulema will achieve a greater yield per hectare and this will help her earn a greater income for her family.

Zulema has had two past loans and they were both paid on time and responsibly. They help her capitalize the plantation by sowing on additional hectares of agricultural land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to weed her fields.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín es un padre de familia de 50 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío Paccha que pertenece al distrtito de Chulucanas a una hora del departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, artesanía y turismo.

Martín se dedica  a la crianza de ganado ovino y porcino (tiene 12 ovejas y 8 cerdos en su corral ) desde hace varios años, su corral donde se encuentran sus ovejas y cerdos están en la parte posterior de su casa.  A sus animales los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo los ofrece en el mercado de las distintas ciudades.  Con el dinero que va adquirir por la venta de sus ovejas y cerdos, podrá atender las necesidades diarias de su hogar y familia.  También cuenta con unas hectáreas de tierras de cultivo donde  siembra maíz y algodón.

A solicitado un préstamo Martín a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para  comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales  asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de los mismos y también para la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo y mejore la calidad de sus productos una vez que los cosecha .

Martín es conocida en la zona por ser una hombre trabajadora, que con mucho empeño desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia,en especial la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martin is the father of a family. He is 50-years old and he lives with his wife and children in a house which they own. It is located in the community of Paccha in the district of Chulucanas. It is one hour from the department of Piura. This region's primary businesses are agricultural, farming, crafts, and tourism.

Martin has been raising sheep and pigs (he has 12 sheep and 8 pigs in his corral) for many years. The corral where he keeps his sheep and pigs is located in the rear section of his property. He raises his livestock with balanced feed and natural grasses. When they have reached an optimum size and weight he offers them for sale in the markets of different cities. With the funds he will acquire from for the sale of his sheep and pigs he will be able to provide for the daily needs of his home and family. He also has a few hectares of farm land where he cultivates corn and cotton.

Martin has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. He will purchase from Capital Semilla balanced feed for his livestock to ensure a good development and fattening. He will also purchase fertilizers for his plantation to improve the quality of the products at the time of the harvest.

Martin is known in the region for being a hard working man who is ready to work hard to provide his family with a better quality of life, especially for his children.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock and to purchase fertilizers for his farm land.

loans.name: Fuente De Libano Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fuente de Libano integrado por dos mujeres y un hombre, son vecinos y residentes de la comunidad de Fray Lazaro Choluteca, viven ahí desde hace muchos años,  se conocen muy bien y decidieron formar este grupo  para salir adelante con sus negocios, ellos se tienen mucha confanza entre si y se concideran responsables.
Merlin C. se dedica a la cria de cerdos, Eva y Norma se dedican a la produccion y venta de tortillas y golosinas.
el credito lo utilizaran para la compra de materia prima para sus negocios.
Merlin cada semana saca varios cerdos para la venta, Eva fabrica mas de 1,000.00 tortillas diarias y las vende en Choluteca y Norma sale a los lugares aledaños y a las escuelas a vender su ricas golosinas.
la meta de este grupo es salir adelante con sus negocios y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The group's name is "Fuente de Libano" and it is made up of two women and one man. They are neighbors and residents of the community of Fray Lazaro Choluteca. They have lived there for many years and they know each other very well. They decided to form the group to help their businesses. They impart a great degree of trust on each other and they consider themselves to be responsible. 

Merlin C. raises pigs. Eva and Norma make and sell tortillas and sweets.

They will use their loan to purchase products for their businesses. 

Merlin takes several pigs to sell every week. Eva makes more than 1000 tortillas every day and she sells them in Choluteca. Norma visits the distant villages and schools to sell her delicious sweets. 

The group's goal is to move forward with their businesses and to provide a better quality of life to their children.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, lime, corn, water, and pork, chicken, and beef meat, vegetables.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos,  tiene casa propia con servicio sólode luz, ubicada en el caserio Cruce de Vega  que pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Todas estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Genoveva se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales  (gallinas, pavos, pollos y ovejas), el corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con dieta balanceada y pastos naturales.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso ideal en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Piura;  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta en su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado Genoveva es de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla, será destinado  para la compra de alimentos balanceados y la implementación de otro corral ya que sus animales se han incrementado donde y crien más cómodos, con la finalidad de que engorden para  venderlos a un buen precio en el mercado y así poder pagar su préstamo, lo que le ayudara  a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Genoveva es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa  que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder ofrecerles algo mejor para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Genoveva is the mother of a family. She is 39-years old and she lives with her husband and children. They have a house of their own and it is equipped only with hydro. It is located in the community of Cruce de Vega in the district of Tambogrande. It is about 40 minutes from the department of Piura. The primary businesses in each of these regions are agriculture, farming, and tourism.

Genoveva raises and sells livestock (poultry, turkeys, and sheep). The corral where she keeps them is located outside her house and she feeds them a balanced diet and natural grasses. She sells her livestock once they have reached an ideal size and weight at the different markets in the city of Piura. This increases her income and helps her to acquire what she needs for the home.

The loan that Genoveva requests is in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) through Capital Semilla. The funds will be used to purchase balanced feed and to install another corral. Her livestock has increased in number and she needs it to raise them more comfortably. The goal is to fatten them before their sale to acquire a good price at the market. This will help her repay her loan and it will help her improve the quality of life for her family. 

Genoveva is a very hard working and earnest woman who has always known to move forward and to improve in life, and to offer her children something better.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock and to install another corral.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to provide maintenance repairs to his car.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino es una padre de familia de 55 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos,  tiene casa propia con servicio sólode luz, ubicada en lazona rural del distrito de Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Todas estos lugares desarrollan la actividad agícola, ganadera y turismo.

Paulino es agricultor desde hace 10 años, cuenta con varias hectáreas de terreno en los cuales cultiva limón y mango, estos productos que cultiva son muy rentables, en especial el limón ya que no necesita mucho tiempo para cosechar, mientras que el mango sólo se cosecha en época de verano (desde diciembre a febrero), pero gracias a los ingresos que obtiene  puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y familia.

Por eso Paulino ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra a las personas que le ayudan a cuidar sus tierras de cultivo y así pueda seguir creciendo su negocio e incrmentando sus ganacias.

Paulinoes un hombre responsable y muy considerado con las personas que trabajan con él, ya que gracias a su labor, todos pueden llevar un poco de dinero a casa para sus gastos disrios.
texts.en:
Paulino is the father of a family. He is 55 years old and he lives with his wife and children. They have a house of their own and it is only equipped with hydro. It is located in the rural region of the district of Tambogrande, at about 40 minutes from the department of Piura. The primary businesses for each of these regions is agriculture, farming, and tourism.

Paulino has been an agriculturist for the past 10 years. He has several hectares of land where he cultivates lemons and mangoes. The products that he cultivates are very profitable, especially lemons because it doesn't take much time to yield a harvest. Mangoes, on the other hand, yield only one harvest during the summer season (from December to February). But thanks to these sources of income he is able to provide for the household expenses and those of his family.

For this reason Paulino has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the among of 1500 neuvos soles through Capital Semilla. He will purchase fertilizers and he will hire farm hands to help him maintain his cultivation fields. This will help him keep expanding his business and to increase his earnings.

Paulino is a responsible man who is very considerate of individuals who work with him. It is thanks to their labor that they are able to take home a little bit of money for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to hire help.

loans.name: Claudia Banessa

texts.es:
